text.0: who now is he what god among immortals of whose auspicious name we may bethink us.
text.1: who shall to mighty aditi restore us that i may see my father and my mother.
text.2: agni the god the first among the immortalsof his auspicious name let us bethink us.
text.3: he shall to mighty aditi restore us that i may see my father and my mother.
text.4: to thee o savitar the lord of precious things who helpest us.
text.5: continually for our share we come.
text.6: wealth highly lauded ere reproach hath fallen on it which is laid.
text.7: free from all hatred in thy hands.
text.8: through thy protection may we come to even the height of affluence.
text.9: which bhaga hath dealt out to us.
text.10: neer have those birds that fly through air attained to thy high dominion or thy might or spirit.
text.11: nor these the waters that flow on for ever nor hills abaters of the winds wild fury.
text.12: varuṇa king of hallowed might sustaineth erect the trees stem in the baseless region.
text.13: its rays whose root is high above stream downward deep may they sink within us and be hidden.
text.14: king varuṇa hath made a spacious pathway a pathway for the sun wherein to travel.
text.15: where no way was he made him set his footstep and warned afar whateer afflicts the spirit.
text.16: a hundred balms are thine o king a thousand deep and widereaching also be thy favours.
text.17: far from us far away drive thou destruction put from us een the sin we have committed.
text.18: whither by day depart the constellations that shine at night set high in heaven above us.
text.19: varuṇas holy laws remain unweakened and through the night the moon moves on in splendor.
text.20: i ask this of thee with my prayer adoring thy worshipper craves this with his oblation.
text.21: varuṇa stay thou here and be not angry steal not our life from us o thou wideruler.
text.22: nightly and daily this one thing they tell me this too the thought of mine own heart repeateth.
text.23: may he to whom prayed fettered Śunaḥśepa may he the sovran varuṇa release us.
text.24: bound to three pillars captured Śunaḥśepa thus to the Āditya made his supplication.
text.25: him may the sovran varuṇa deliver wise neer deceived loosen the bonds that bind him.
text.26: with bending down oblations sacrifices o varuṇa we deprecate thine anger.
text.27: wise asura thou king of wide dominion loosen the bonds of sins by us committed.
text.28: loosen the bonds o varuṇa that hold me loosen the bonds above between and under.
text.29: so in thy holy law may we made sinless belong to aditi o thou Āditya.
